H0.text: A bar graph is a diagram in which the numerical values of variables are represented by the height or length of lines or rectangles of equal width.

H1.text: Pie chart is a diagram in which the numerical values of variables are represented by the height or length of lines or rectangles of equal width.

H2.text: Venn diagram is a diagram in which the numerical values of variables are represented by the height or length of lines or rectangles of equal width.

H3.text: Circle graph is a diagram in which the numerical values of variables are represented by the height or length of lines or rectangles of equal width.

A4.text: Variable-width bar charts, sometimes abbreviated variwide (bar) charts, are bar charts having bars with non-uniform widths.
